greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If 2^(n-1) mod n = 1, then 1 else 0.
comment: This first differs from A010051 (1 if n is prime, else 0) at the second term. The next position differing from A010051 is at the 341st term, and further divergences appear for odd pseudoprimes to base 2 (A001567).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..68101
mathematica: f[n_] := If[PowerMod[2, n - 1, n] == 1, 1, 0]; Array[f, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 28 2015 *)
program: (PARI) A257531(n) = if(n==1, 0, if(Mod(2, n)^(n-1)==1, 1, 0)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, _Michel Marcus_ & _Altug Alkan_, Sep 13-20 2017
xref: Characteristic function for A176997 (without its initial 1).
results.author: _Gerald Hillier_, Apr 28 2015
